intro: Cheiropetalum radians, commonly known as the radiate cheiropetalum, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its showy, radially symmetric flowers that typically feature a central cluster of tubular flowers surrounded by petal-like structures. The plant is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in the Andean foothills. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats. The flowers bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
